author: lennext
title: Universal Tourism Payment System
description: Small nations depending on tourism are hurt by offshore payments. Attempts to use VAT to track spending requires high administrative costs.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well laid and clearly addresses the problem statement. The proposal taps into the tourism sector, which many of the small nations depend completely on for their survival, and also where most of the loopholes lie that governments find hard to tackle. The impact the proposal could have is huge. However, the portion I find hard wrapping my head around is the success of the proposal provided it's not the first of its kind and how effectively this could fill in the void the previous ones have left in the system. Hence, I rate the impact of the project with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience the team members bring to the community is huge. The team members have been working alongside the sectors that play an enormous part in the proposed project, namely small businesses, tourism, blockchain, and many more. The team will be introducing new members to Catalyst through meetings with tourism organizations and government agencies. Apparently, the successful implementation of the proposal completely depends on how accepting these fragments of the system are. A detailed game plan on how the team plans to overcome such an obstacle would help the community realize the success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The team seems to be well versed with the problem at hand and has laid out the possible performance indicators that the community can use to track its progress. The team also seems to address the possible difficulties and risks involved. I believe the team is well capable of overcoming these hitches. The team plans to provide a proof of concept using the Palau government as their majority metric for the purpose of audit. Nevertheless, it would be highly appreciated if they could provide other metrics such as cost of quality and customer satisfaction index to help understand the impact the project is bringing to the proposed sector and how well it is being received by the customers.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks to solve the problem of tax avoidance by offshore tourism payments by a prepaid ADA-based payment dApp with automatic tax collection which aligns with the challenge goal of foundational Revenue Service.
The proposal is an excellent example of articulating the value to Cardano ecosystem and articulating how the solution scales to address future challenges.
The proposal does a good job of providing key metrics and goals that align with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is an excellent example of evidence of experience, team composition, challenges and risks.
The proposal articulates the feasibility aspects of budget is broken down and reasonable, realistic timetable and plan, resources required, detailed technical explanation of the solution
The proposal's feasibility could be improved by an additional funding plan.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal is an excellent example of a clear understandable description of the targeted problem and a detailed description of the solution that addresses the problem.
The proposal includes a roadmap, milestones, time horizon, metrics/KPIs to measure proposal success.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal of decentralized tax administration in the tourism sector and the use of cryptocurrencies to pay tourism sector expenses. Regarding the intention of the proposal, write in detail, have a clear plan as well as state the actual adverse cases and solutions to deal with when implementing in practice. Experienced team.
f6_assessments.q1: This is the time to push further blockchain applications into practice, especially a good platform like cardano. Although the proposal does not indicate the most detailed strategies, especially legal ones, when working with each locality, the project is quite serious in terms of the proposed ideas. Have a clear plan as well as team information. This is also a highly practical idea, hopefully in the near future more state agencies will be more serious about deploying this application.
f6_assessments.q2: Re-verification of applications in practice is easy on the online platform, but to verify the information provided by the projects requires the participation of many reputable government departments, and government agencies. papers are authorized to be deployed in the localities. Moreover, changing tax habits of companies and tourism services is quite difficult without accompanying synchronous technology devices.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal meets and exceeds the Brief stated goal of using blockchain in a foundational governmental activity to promote sustainable prosperity. Accurately assessing and collecting tax is just the right sort of action.
f6_assessments.q1:
This team is competent and well prepared. This is a very complex project,and the team has an appropriate portfolio of skills.
The plan is set out stepwise in a logically prudent manner.
f6_assessments.q2: the stepwise presentation is auditable, time-fenced, specific and measurable. The project's information is sufficient to audit the progress and success for the community.
